meanings.definition: Having or showing a mild, kind, or tender temperament.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was gentler than the big dog.
meanings.sent2: She spoke in a gentler tone to comfort her friend.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to act gentler by purring loudly.
meanings.sent4: His gentler approach to problem-solving won him many friends.
meanings.sent5: The gentler touch of the nurse made the patient feel safe.

meanings.definition: Not harsh or severe; mild or soft.
meanings.sent1: The gentler soap was perfect for sensitive skin.
meanings.sent2: The breeze felt gentler as the storm passed.
meanings.sent3: The gentler sunlight made the flowers bloom beautifully.
meanings.sent4: Her gentler criticism was easier to accept than his harsh words.
meanings.sent5: The gentler music helped him relax after a long day.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a moderate degree of anything.
meanings.sent1: The gentler slope of the hill was easier to climb.
meanings.sent2: The gentler flavor of the tea was soothing on her throat.
meanings.sent3: The gentler rain was just enough to water the plants.
meanings.sent4: His gentler pace allowed everyone to keep up with him.
meanings.sent5: The gentler colors of the painting created a peaceful atmosphere.
